1.content:
Sam ran through the jungle as fast as she could. The T-rex was right behind her and was closing fast. It was almost upon her when she managed to slide into a small cave. she spun around quickly and her a large crash as the dinosaur smashed into the wall of the cave: it could not fit through the entrance after her. It stuck it's snout through the hole, but could not reach her. After a moment it gave up and walked away, certainly to try and find another entrance. Samantha had been on the island for 3 years and that T-rex had been chasing her the whole time, never letting up. She had taken to calling it "the Hunter" and had no illusions about having escaped it now.

She would have liked to stay in the cave, but she had made that mistake before and had been nearly eaten by it's owner, a huge snake. She decided it would probably be a good idea to keep moving. There were two passages ahead of her:

One passage led back outside. The entrance was covered in vines, so the Hunter probably had not noticed it. The risk of it lying in wait for her that way was low, but it would certainly find her trail eventually: it always did.

The other passage led deeper into the cave. The ground was wet and it was dark, but not so much that she would be completely blind. The entrance to this passage was small enough that the Hunter would not be able to fit, even if it found it's way through the other entrance. On the downside, there could be something just as dangerous lurking deeper in the cave, and she was starting to get hungry and would have to leave the cave eventually to find food.
1.title: Close call

11.content:
After thinking about it for a few minutes, Sam realized she was even hungrier than she thought, so she decided to go out and look for food.

She exited the cave very cautiously, alert for any sign of danger in case the Hunter had noticed the side entrance after all, but it was nowhere to be seen, she had escaped it. For now...
As she walked away from the cave, her stomach began to growl. She would need to find food fast. She was a great hunter though, and had already picked out the sounds of several potential meals not far from her location.

Straight ahead, she could hear birds chirping. She quite liked birds because they moved around a lot after being swallowed, a feeling she enjoyed intensely. They were understandably hard to catch however, even with her enhanced speed.
To her left, she had seen some small rodents crawling around. They weren't particularly appetizing, but they would do and wouldn't be to difficult to catch.
Lastly, off to her right, she had heard the splashing and small voices of what sounded like some miniature mermaids. She had only managed to catch a few of them during her time on the island as they were rare and very quick, but she knew from experience that they were delicious.
She would have to choose quickly, because the Hunter would surely be back after her again soon, and then there would be no time for food.
11.title: Go back outside

113.content:
Sam decided that the mermaids were tasty enough to risk trying to catch one, so she headed off to her right.

She soon came upon a small pond with a little stream going through it, and sure enough, there were three mini-mermaids splashing about in it. Better yet, the jungle had grown up around the pond quite a bit, so she could probably get pretty close without being seen. She slowly and quitely crept toward the mermaids, being careful to stay out of sight.

Eventually, she managed to get as close as she could. From here, the mermaids would definetly see her if she got any closer, so she had have to pounce from here. She took a short moment of preperation, and then jumped out into the pond! After a short struggle, she walked back out of the pond with...
113.title: The mermaids

choices: Two of them, but she missed one
1132.content: How many of them did she get?
1132.title: She caught some.

choices: Keep it, stay near the water.
Let it go, it would limit her movement too much.
11323.content:
Pleased and impressed with herself, Sam walked away from the pond with all three of the mermaids. She eyed her prizes, three miniature mermaids that were each between 8 inches and a foot long. Pretty big, but they were slippery and would go down easy. The walk from the cave to the pond had taken a while, and it had taken even longer to creep up close enough to the pond to strike, as a result, she was so hungry that she couldn't help but stuff one of the mermaids into her mouth straight away. Her throat expanded beyond would any normal person could do, and she quickly gulped the mermaid down, struggling all the way.

As she looked at the other two mermaids, which had already started to panic, she realized that she probably would not be able to eat both of them. She was still hungry after the first one but they were pretty big, and she figured the second would probably be more than enough. She mulled this over while she put another mermaid in her mouth, taking her time with this one. She put just it's upper half in her mouth, leaving the fish half hanging out while she teased the unfortunate creature. She licked over it's face and bare breasts a lot, completely covering it in saliva. She wasn't trying to be mean, she just loved the taste of mermaid and she wanted to enjoy this one after downing the first so quickly. After a few moments, she finally swallowed the mermaid, sending it down to her stomach with the other one. She could still feel them wiggling in her stomach for several moments afterward.

She looked at the last mermaid, and decided she had been right about not being able to eat it as well. She would love to save it for later, but the things didn't last long out of water and did not taste good at all once they were dried out. If she were to keep it, she would probably have to stay near the water to keep it refreshed, especially since she would probably need sleep before she was ready to eat again. Speaking of which, she really needed to put some distance between her and the Hunter if she didn't want it to find her while she was sleeping.

What should she do?
11323.title: All three!

113231.content:
Sam decided to keep the mermaid with her. It wouldn't be THAT much trouble and it would save her from having to hunt again later, which would be a definite plus if the Hunter managed to catch up to her because she wouldn't have time to do alot of hunting then. She kept a tight grip on the last mermaid as she began running down stream, doing her best not leave a too-obvious trail for the Hunter to follow. She was good at moving about quickly, but her bloated belly was slowing her down a little, and her still-struggling meal made her want to sit down and rest even though she knew she couldn't.

After several hours, it was starting to get dark. She still had an hour, maybe two before she would be forced to stop, and that was a lot of time to put some distance behind her. On the other hand, she had found a very nice camping spot for the night. It was a small cave right by the stream she had been following, it was small enough to where it only took a quick look to see that no dangerous animals were inside, but there was a corner in the back she could hide in where no predator would be able to see her unless they actually walked all the way to the back of cave. She couldn't ask for a better camping spot, but it would be good to put some more distance behind her before she stopped for the night.

While she was making up her mind, she stopped to dip the mermaid in the water as it was starting to look faint. She noted that it had not said a single word, even before she captured it. She knew some mermaids could speak, but due to this one's silence, she assumed it was not one of them.

After a few moments of thought, she decided to...
113231.title: Keep it, stay near the water.

1132311.content:
Sam decided it would be better to stay in the relative safety of the cave for the night rather than risk being caught out in the open when the sun goes down. The first thing she did was dig a small hole and fill it with water from the stream and put the mermaid in it. She covered the opening with sticks to use as bars and weighed them down with some rocks that were in the cave. Oddly, the mermaid just seemed happy to actually be in the water rather than just having a dip. After making sure it couldn't escape, Sam laid down and went to sleep.

When she awoke, the first thing she noticed was that her belly was now almost completely flat. The sun was starting to come up and she needed to get moving quickly. She checked the trap and found the mermaid still sleeping. She wasn't very hungry, but she could definately eat and the mermaid was slowing her down and restricting her movement to the stream...
1132311.title: Stay for the night.

11323111.content:
Sam decided it would be best to go ahead and eat the mermaid, that way she would be free to move wherever she wished instead of having to stay near the water. She removed the sticks keeping it barred in and quickly grabbed it, waking it up. She stuffed the thing in her mouth before it was even awake enough to try and escape. She held it in her mouth for several minutes, tasting it's delicious breasts, before she finally gulped down. As soon as the mermaid landed in her stomach, she started to get moving. It wouldn't do to stay for much longer, she had certainly lost distance ahead of the Hunter over the night.

However, just as she was exiting the cave, she heard something moving. She stood completely still, hoping it wouldn't notice her. She waited for a moment, when suddenly the offender came into sight. It was...
11323111.title: Eat it now.

113231111.content: A giant snake slithered it's way out of the bushes right in front of her. It didn't take long for it to notice her, and she immedietely moved as fast as she could, but not fast enough. The snake quickly and easily coiled her up, and immedietely stuffed her head into it's mouth. It's not looking good, but Sam starts to think she hears something else moving out there...
113231111.title: Something dangerous.

choices: Something that wants to eat the snake.
Something that wants to eat Sam.
1132311111.content: What is she rescued by?
1132311111.title: She's rescued.

11323111112.content:
The snake manages to get it's jaws around Sam's shoulders, but all of a sudden she feels a violent movement, sees light, and then nothing. She comes to mere seconds later, and realizes that she was thrown from the snake's mouth when it was grabbed by something much larger. As she looked up, she was looking right at the Hunter.

The huge T-rex stood only a few yards away with the huge snake still in it's mouth, but it didn't seem interested in the snake. It looked directly at Sam, and then tossed the snake aside. The snake, being wounded and far too smart to compete with the Hunter for a meal, simply slithered away. The Hunter stared at Sam for only a few seconds before charging her, and she ran as fast as she could.
11323111112.title: Something that wants to eat Sam.

113231111121.content:
Sam could feel pain in the back of her head. She didn't know why, she only knew it hurt. But that didn't matter now, all that mattered was that she had to escape. The Hunter was dangerously close behind her and she was only barely keeping away from it's snapping jaws. She runs as fast as she can, and starts to gain some distance from the Hunter. Unfortunately, it was not enough to give her some thinking time when she suddenly came upon the edge of a cliff. She barely stopped in time to avoid running right over the edge, but she almost thought that might not have been a bad plan given her other option. The Hunter now came upon her slowly, knowing it's prey was caught. She was trying to decide whether or not to jump over the cliff when the decision was made for her.

The pounding of the Hunter's footsteps caused the edge of the cliff to weaken, and eventually collapse with Sam still on it. She slid, dangerously fast, down the face of the cliff and came to a rest at the bottom. As she stood up and checked herself, she was shocked to discover that she was mostly alright, just a few scratches and bruises. She looked up to the top of the cliff to see the Hunter, obviously furious about having lost it's prey given the roar it let out, and then it stalked away, looking for a way to climb down the cliff.

Sam felt the back of her head, where the pain was still throbbing. She realized she must have been thrown against a tree when she was thrown from the snake's mouth. It wasn't a problem, as her abilities allowed her to heal quickly, especially if she could find somewhere to rest. It was still early morning, but it had only been a few moments since she ate that last mermaid, so food wouldn't be a problem. She had no idea how long it would take for the Hunter to get down the cliff. Maybe long enough for her to rest, or maybe not.
113231111121.title: She escapes... For now.

1132311111211.content:
As soon as Sam moved, her head started throbbing. There was no way she was going to be able to move quickly like this, and stumbling around the woods would only make her easier to find. She started looking around for somewhere to rest, and eventually spotted a nice spot in a nearby tree. The branches came together in such a way that would be a comfortable place to sit, but not so much that it looked like it had been done on purpose by some creature. She quickly jumped up to the first branch and scrambled up to the tree, and then held onto the branch tightly as her head started hurting again from the quick movement. When the pain subsided, she laid down on the branches and rested.

After about an hour, her wound is almost completely healed and she starts to get up to leave, when she suddenly hears something...
1132311111211.title: Look for somewhere to rest.

11323111112112.content: Sam jumps up as the tree starts to come to life. She looks down, knowing that the jump was far enough to hurt pretty bad even with enhanced abilities, but she'd live. She makes the jump, but only makes it half way to the ground before a hand-like branch swings around and catches her. She struggles in it's grip but is unable to escape. It holds her up to it's face, which was nearly invisible with when it's eyes and mouth were closed, and it looks her over carefully. After a moment, it opens it's mouth and...
11323111112112.title: The tree is alive!

choices: Wants to make friends with the tree.
113231111121121.content:
The tree began to speak in it's slow, deep, creaking voice.
"And now before me comes a face unknown... I would know your name before you've flown."
Sam was quite surprised to see the tree talk, or rather hear it, but she quickly decided it would not be a good idea to keep a creature of this size waiting, even if it did seem friendly.
"M-my name's Samantha. W-what about you?"
The tree took a deep, slow breath, and responded:
"A name it wishes of me? I am known as the Elder Tree. Fear not young child, you are not my food, now what be your business, in this wood?"
Sam...
113231111121121.title: It speaks! (it's friendly)

1132311111211212.content:
"Well, actually I'd like to make friends with you, I mean, if that's ok." Sam replied, still nervous.
The Elder Tree let out a long laugh, and then slowly responded:
"You seem much surprised to me, if that truly is what your purpose be."
Sam was afraid that the Elder Tree thought she was lieing, so she quickly amended her statement.
"Well, I mean, I WAS just passing through, but now that I know your here..."
The Tree seemed to think this was an acceptable answer.
"Your friendship gladly I would take, a thirst for speech it would slake. Though companionship may not be found, for still I am rooted to the ground."

Sam was disappointed that the Tree would not be able to accompany her, but it had been a long time before she actually stopped to talk to someone, or even something. It would certainly be a welcome relief, but on the other hand, she didn't have much time to waste as the Hunter would surely be on her again soon. Still, the Tree was pretty huge, it's possible that even if the Hunter did show up, he'd be able to protect her from it.
1132311111211212.title: Wants to make friends with the tree.

11323111112112121.content:
Sam decides that a good conversation with an intelligent creature is worth the risk of hanging around for awhile. She stays and talks to the Tree, and she thoroughly enjoys it, despite the fact that she must often stop and think about what he just said to make sense of his rhyming words.

After a couple hours though, she suddenly regrets her decision when she hears the rhythmic stomping that signals the approach of the Hunter. It spots her, and immedietetly begins charging. "Ahh! It's here!" Sam yelled, having already explained about the Hunter to the Elder Tree. She was just starting to panic when all of a sudden the Hunter tripped, and was quickly covered in vines from the surrounding trees!

The Elder Tree slowly set Sam down, and then looked over at the Hunter and said:
"Guardian, what be your purpose here? I have promised this girl she has nothing to fear."
The Hunter made no reply except to gnash at the vines holding it in place. The Elder Tree saw his attempt at communication were useless and looked at Sam.
"Our roots will not hold him long, but when he's freed, you should be gone."
Sam took that as her que to run, yelling a quick thank you over her shoulder as she did so.

After several hours of running, Sam finally stopped to look back. She saw no sign of the Hunter, and she was pretty sure it would lose her trail at least a couple times whenever it got close to catching up. She has once again managed to buy herself more time of respite, but she couldn't help but wonder about her new friend. She doubted the Hunter would take the time to harm the Tree once it got free, but she couldn't but wonder if she would ever see the Tree again. The island was huge, and even after three years there were huge areas of it that she hadn't even seen. It was unlikely she would be able to find her way back to the Tree again. "But you never know," she thought. "Where in the future you will go.." Then she let out a groan as she realized that whe was starting to rhyme now.

Her thoughts were interrupted by her stomach growling. The last mermaid had been pretty much completely digested now and she was starting to get hungry again. On the other hand, it was starting to get late and she should probably look for somewhere safe to sleep.
11323111112112121.title: Stay and chat awhile.

113231111122.content:
Sam is running as fast as she can, but despite her increased agility, she loses her footing and falls to the ground. She squeezes her eyes shut, knowing the Hunter would be on her any second... But to her surprise, nothing happens. After a few seconds she finally builds up enough courage to stand, her legs shaking. Her heart is pounding as she tries to figure out what happened to the Hunter, but when she turns around she quickly figures it out, as she is staring right down it's throat. It had only been waiting for her to stand up.

In one instant, it grabs her and closes it's mouth around her upper body, being careful not to cut her with it's teeth. It's tongue rubs all over her face, and then moves to her breasts, both to savor her taste and coat her in saliva to make her easier to swallow. As it finished with her upper body, it pulled her farther into it's mouth. Her head was now just outside the beast's throat and the only thing still outside it's mouth was her feet. It's tongue continued it's job of tasting her as it slowly moved over belly, which was still squirming slightly with the mermaid inside. It took a particular liking to her pussy, forcing her legs apart so it get it's tongue in between them and forcefull rub against her cleanly shaven pussy, delighting with the flavors it found there.

Eventually however, the Hunter grew bored with this and finally started to swallow. After spending so much time in it's mouth, Sam was almost relieved to be getting it over with. Her head was quickly sucked into it's throat and was soon followed by the rest of her body. She slowly slid down it's throat, one huge swallow at a time, until she was finally deposited in it's stomach. The walls immedietely contracted around her, squeezing her, as the stomach began to fill with acid. She could feel it burning her, and after only a few more minutes of this, she passed out.

The Hunter burped slightly and then laid down for a rest. When it awoke, Sam had been completely digested. It stood up, took a good stretch, let out a massive roar that could be heard across the island, and then, it's job of keeping humans off the island complete, it turned back into the statue it always had been.
113231111122.title: She trips!

choices: Look for a place to camp.
1132312.content:
Sam continued to follow the stream, still carrying the mermaid with her. As time went by, her bloated belly slowly returned to normal as she digested the mermaids. She continued to travel for a short time longer before she had to rest, dipping the mermaid in water every-so-often.

Soon she began to feel hungry again, and decided it was time to eat the last mermaid. The mermaid began to start shaking as she heard Sam's stomach start to growl again. Sam raised the terrified creature to her face, and opened her mouth, putting the mermaid in head first. The mermaid, knowing she had no chance, didn't even struggle. After enjoying the flavor for a minute, Sam began to swallow, sending the mermaid down into her stomach.

Sam could feel her meal squirming inside, and began to rub her belly gently. Sam decides that she needs to continue on, and walks further down the stream, trying to decide whether to look for a place to camp, or more food.

Sam decides to...
1132312.title: Continue on.

info.brief_description: Samantha is hunted by a T-rex on vore island, but that's not the only danger.
info.description:
This story is about Samantha, a 19 year old girl who has lives on vore island and is always being chased by a black t-rex, so she must always keep moving to avoid it. There are many other creatures on the island as well that are dangerous however.

Rules:
Soft oral vore only! no hard vore, cockvore etc.
Samantha is nude, she does not need clothes since she is the only human on the island and she does not have time to make or look for any.
Samantha must eat every now and then, she doesn't have time to prepare her food but she has developed the ability to swallow small animals, (about the size of a rabbit or smaller) without much difficulty. There are also miniature Mermaids, nagas, dragons, etc. on the island that she can eat in addition to the full sized ones.
Samantha cannot escape the island.
Samantha cannot kill the T-rex that hunts her, or make friends with it in any way. These rules do not apply to the islands other inhabitants.

Samantha's abilities:
Samantha has gained a few abilities in her time on vore island, they are as follows.
Can swallow whole any animal smaller than a full grown rabbit.
Can regenerate most wounds, as a result, the story only ends if she is eaten.
She can also run much faster and is more agile than normal.

Samantha, (or Sam, for short) must always keep on the move to keep the T-rex from catching up to her, but she must remember to eat every so often and she must watch out for the islands other inhabitants as well, which include dragons, giant snakes, nagas, mermaids and others in full sized as well as miniature form. Have fun!
